page.title: 08Hindlip Hall
page.content: This site was mentioned in the Domesday Book as 'Hisndeted with eight inhabitants'. Since then there have been several different buildings on the site with the present main hall dating from 1820. It has been used as a private house, boarding school and a military hospital (1939-1945). Since 1946 it has been a police Headquarters, originally for Worcestershire and in more recent years for the West Mercia Constabulary - covering Shropshire, Herefordshire and Worcestershire. We saw the main operations room where there are many computers and tv cameras monitoring the M5 motorway. We saw the police dogs in training and examined the motorway patrol vehicles. We also visted the small 16th C church adjacent to the Hall.
